name: FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure that all employees and subcontractors are:
– using the correct and complete set of drawings
– all drawings are the latest revision
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Drawings and drawing registers
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
1.2 Implementation of all measures and controls
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All necessary measures and controls are being implemented, that is: PSP, EMP, TMP, JSEA, SWMS & WP
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: PSP, EMP, TMP, JSEA, SWMS, WP
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Precast reinforced concrete pipes shall be accepted on the basis of full compliance with the requirements of this section and AS/NZS 4058.
○ Precast Reinforced Concrete Box Culverts to comply with requirements of VicRoads Section 619.
○ Precast Reinforced Concrete (Portland) Pipes shall comply with requirements of AS 4058
○ All concrete shall be manufactured to the concrete mix design registered by VicRoads and comply with the requirements of Section 610.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed, Manufacturer certificate or accreditation
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Materials used for bedding and selected backfill shall be free from perishable matter and lumps and shall conform with the requirements of Table 701.091 and Table 701.092.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ordinary backfill shall be free from perishable matter and shall conform with the requirements of Table 701.091.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Cementituous grouts shall be minimum Type C class dual shinkage compensating, with a minimum 28 day compressive strength of 40 Mpa
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Test Reports from supplier
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: An excavation permit must be issued prior to any excavation commencing.
○ Plant and equipment shall be appropriate for the task.
○ Excavation operations shall not disturb areas outside the limit of excavation
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The position of all drainage lines are to be confirmed with the superintendent

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Horizontal clearance ( between the walls of trench to the side of pipe shall be 300mm – 600mm for pipes, and 0.5 to 1 times the overall height of the culvert for box culverts. Trench walls to be vertical where practical
○ > 100mm below underside of pipe (for pipe width < 1500 mm)
○ > 200mm below underside of pipe (for pipe width > 1500 mm)
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: A minimum clearance of 400mm is required around the external faces of precast pits.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Compacted to refusal using mechanical plant.

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Bedding and backfill materials shall be placed and compacted in layers not exceeding 150 mm loose thickness. Bedding shall be compacted to refusal using hand held mechanical equipment. Bedding material which has a swell equal to or greater than 2.5% shall be maintained at a mean moisture ratio of 92% between the completion of rolling and the placement of the overlying layer.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: ITP Signed, Photos
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Pipes & pits placed as shown on the drawings. No laying to occur until bedding lines and levels and compaction requirements have been satisfied
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: ITP Signed, Photos
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All interlocking (flush) joint reinforced concrete pipes shall be mortar jointed, or wrapped with a 200 mm wide external joint rubber band.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: ITP Signed, Photos
2.10 Sealing - for joining culvert sections and pipe penetrations in pits

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Contact areas between top and bottom sections of box culverts to be mortared. The joints between various components such as drainage pits, access chambers and pipes shall be made watertight using a cementitious mortar in accordance with the requirements of Clause 610.32.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: ITP Signed, Photos
2.11 Survey of laid pipe or pit

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The location of each run of drainage has been verified prior to backfilling and conforms to the following tolerances: (a) offset of entry pits required to match lines of kerbs or barriers ±20 mm
(b) plan location of pits other than offsets to kerb lines or barriers ±100 mm
(c) invert level of pipes at pits ±50 mm
(d) departure from design grade of pipe runs ±10 mm in 10 m provided minimum grade is not less than 1:250
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: ITP Signed, As-built
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Height of additional bedding material = 30% of nominal pipe diameter or culvert height.
○ Compacted to refusal using hand held mechanical equipment.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: ITP Signed, Photos
2.13 Place & compact backfill material over pipes
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Backfill under paved area: fill trench with selected back fill material to subgrade level
○ Backfill under area not paved: Back fill trench with selected back fill to a level 0.3 m above the top of pipe or culvert, and ordinary back fill above that level
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: ITP Signed, Photos
2.14 Place & compact backfill material around pits
○ Compacted to refusal using hand held mechanical equipment.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: ITP Signed, Photos
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: ITP Signed, Photos
2.16 Pit base shaped with concrete to match pipe invert
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: As shown on Standard VicRoads drawing - Pit & Pipe Invert levels SD 1002
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Standard VicRoads drawing SD 1002
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: ITP Signed, Photos
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Covers must be set to within ±10mm of the design levels shown on the drawings
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: 705.17, CoM Standard Pit Lid Drawing

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All drainage lines constructed shall be inspected, after completion of earthworks to subgrade level and prior to construction of pavement layers, by an independent testing organisation using closed circuit television (CCTV) to verify that the flow of water is not obstructed by waste construction material left inside and to check for visible signs of defects.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All pipes to be flushed clean upon completion
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Licensed or competent surveyor to provide plans showing location and cover level of fits, bearing of side entry pits, and pipe inverts.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: ITP Signed, As-built plan
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the FH’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.

1.2 Implementation of all measures and controls
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity

REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: PSP, EMP, TMP, JSEA, SWMS, WP
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Subsurface drainage pipes: (behind bluestone wall) 100mm DIA Class 1000kN/m/m corrugated perforated plastic pipe- with a perforation size of maximum 1.5mm width and minimum length of 150 mm per m^2.
○ Subsurface drainage pipes: (in soft landscaping area) 300mm wide megaflo
○ Granular filter material for bedding and backfill: Trench backfilled and bedded with specified material on drawings (clean washed coarse sand for megaflo, 20mm screenings for behind bluestone wall)
○ Flushout risers: constructed to the detail of SD 1631
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off, Delivery dockets, product spec sheets etc.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: An excavation permit must be issued prior to any excavation commencing.
○ Plant and equipment shall be appropriate for the task.
○ Excavation operations shall not disturb areas outside the limit of excavation

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Bottom of trench shall be compacted and at a depth no more than 50mm below the specified pipe invert. Grade of the base of the trench shall not allow ponding of water Any loose material shall be removed.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Bedding of granular filter material, sand or screenings placed across bottom of trench and screeded or graded to level
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: ITP Signed, Photos
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Pipes placed centrally in trench and held firmly in place positioned with openings at the lower half of the pipe.
○ If geofabric required as per Cl 3030.07 (subsurface drains installed in expansive materials), minimum 150mm lap of geotextile used for wrapping.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: ITP Signed, Photos

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Granular filter material placed and compacted compacted in layers not exceeding 300mm with minimal disturbance to pipes. Concrete is to be placed and compacted within one hour of mixing
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: ITP Signed, Photos
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Installed in accordance with drawings and Cl 702.10
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: ITP Signed, Photos
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Licensed or competent surveyor to provide plans showing location and cover level of fits, bearing of side entry pits, and pipe inverts.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: ITP Signed, As-built plan

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The position of all pits are to be confirmed with the superintendent.

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Care shall be taken in removing existing bluestone kerb

○ Bluestone shall be salvaged and re-used in new kerb alignment

○ Alignment of new kerb shall be marked out using string line

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Care shall be taken in removing existing bluestone kerb

○ Bluestone shall be salvaged and re-used in new kerb alignment where possible

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Inspect delivered materials for any chips, cracks or other visible damage.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Line and level of reinstated bluestone kerbing shall be set out according to design levels.
○ Line and level of bluestone pavers, tactiles and inlay shall be set out according to design levels to suit new kerb heights.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off
Construction of Access Ramp Bluestone Footpath
2.1 Re-levelling of bluestone kerbing and ramp
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Bluestone kerbing to be re-installed to new design levels.
○ Bluestone kerb shall be placed on a bed of low slump, 20 Mpa concrete of 75mm minimum thickness.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: IFC Drawings, CoM Bluestone Paving Specification
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Concrete base shall be inspected to be free of foreign materials and water pooling
○ After placing and vibration, the concrete shall be screeded and trowelled to the correct level.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: CoM Bluestone Paving Specification
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Mortar shall be applied at average thickness of 30mm to concrete base
○ All pavers shall be coated in mortar slurry on rear face before laying
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Pavers shall be cut with a diamond blade and allow a 10mm grout line at such points
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Pavers shall be placed in accordance with Dwg 1P50402.
○ Kerb access ramp wings shall be at an angle of 45° and the ramp gradient shall not exceed 1:8.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Pavers shall have >24hrs curing time prior to light traffic
○ Where required, ply shall be laid over area of works
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Pavers shall be grouted using agreed colour and mixture
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off
2.9 Installation of Versatac Granite Tactiles and Granite Inlay
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Tactiles and inlay shall be placed in accordance with Standard Drawing 1P50201.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Pavement area is free of debris and waste
○ Bluestone pavement is free of mortar stains and cleaned to satisfaction
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off
